EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM3618294: Lethal_Paternal_excess_2 [miRNA-Seq]; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Seeds from crosses between multiple individuals were hand-dissected and total embryo or endosperm RNA isolated using the Ambion RNAqueous Micro Kit. The small RNA pool was separated from the larger RNA pool by sequential ethanol addition and filtering. The larger RNA pool was collected on filters after the addition of ethanol equivalent to 60% of the sample volume, and the small RNA pool was collected on filters after the addition of ethanol equivalent to 50% of the flowthrough volume from the larger RNA filter binding step. Libraries for Illumina sequencing were constructed using the NEXTflex Small RNA-Seq Kit v3 as directed (Bioo Scientific Corporation, Austin, Texas). Final library amplification was carried out for 24 cycles and the resultant libraries were size selected with a pippin prep. 40 base single-end sequencing of sRNA libraries was performed on an Illumina HiSeq 2500 machine.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM3618296: Viable_Paternal_excess_2 [miRNA-Seq]; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM4636388: Arabidopsis control #4 [86504]; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted from embryo, L1 larvae, or arabidposis flowers collected in Trizol using a phenol-chloroform-based standard protocol. Small RNA sequencing libraries were constructed from an input of 25-75 embryos, corresponding to an estimated amount of 10-20 ng total RNA RNA libraries were constructed as described in Alberti et al., 2018, Nature Methods. Given the low RNA input the protocol was modified: Less 5'- and 3' linker were used (500 nM final reaction concentration) 18-30 nt size selection for miRNA seq

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1838516: A3; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Gall collection: To perform the RNA isolation from galls with a good efficiency, 250-300 hand dissected galls at 3 days post infection (3 dpi), should be collected. Collect galls and rapidly freeze them to a 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube in liquid nitrogen. Store at -80 °C until further processing (step C) Homogenization: Clean mortar and pestles with acetone, let them dry on the bench and autoclaved to avoid RNase activity. CAUTION: Check that mortar, pestle and pipettes used during the extraction have not been in contact with RNases. Sometimes it is preferable to keep material exclusively for RNA extraction. Add liquid nitrogen into the mortar with the pestle to cold them down. Add the galls into the mortar and proceed into a fume hood. When liquid nitrogen is nearly evaporated, add TRI Reagent® (500-750 μl/200-300 galls at 3 dpi); the total volume should not exceed 10% of the volume of TRI Reagent used for homogenization, as suggested by the TRI Reagent® protocol. Grind galls with a mortar and pestle. TRI Reagent solution initially becomes frozen, but it will melt gradually as a result of the homogenization. Proceed until a liquid appearance is observed and no visible tissue pieces are identified within the Reagent solution. Note: Do not leave traces of galls without homogenizing, since this step can be limiting for good efficiency. Transfer the gall homogenate with a pipette to a 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube and place it on ice while you homogenize the rest of the samples. Phase separation Centrifuge at 12,000 x g for 10 min at 4 °C and transfer the supernatant containing the RNA to a new 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube. Note: The resulting pellet contains membranes, polysaccharides and high molecular weight DNA while the supernatant contains RNA. All insoluble material should be removed from the homogenate. Add 100 μl of chloroform per 500 μl of TRl Reagent® in a fume hood. Cap sample tubes securely. Shake tubes vigorously by hand for 15 s and incubate them at room temperature (RT) for 5 to 10 min. Note: Do not use vortex. Centrifuge the samples at 12,000 x g for 15 min at 4 °C. Transfer the upper aqueous phase to a new tube. RNA precipitation Add 125 μl of isopropanol and 125 μl of high salt buffer per 500 μl of TRl Reagent®. Mix the solution and store it for 5-10 min at RT. Note: The high salt precipitation solution removes contaminating compounds as proteoglycan and polysaccharide from the isolated RNA. Centrifuge at 12,000 x g for 8 min at 4 °C. Discard the supernatant. RNA Wash Wash the RNA pellet with 1 ml of 75% ethanol and mix by inversion several times. Centrifuge at 7,500 x g for 5 min at 4 °C and discard the supernatant. Repeat steps E-1 and 2. Spin 10 sec in a microfuge and discard carefully the remaining liquid. Air dry the pellet for 3-5 min. Do not let the RNA over-dry, as this will make it difficult to dissolve. The white RNA pellet will turn clear when it dries out. Add 100 μl DEPC-water or RNase-free water immediately after the pellet becomes clear. Dissolve RNA by incubating for 10 min at 37 °C followed by 5 min at 60 °C. Store RNA solution at -80 °C or continue with further RNA Cleanup by DNase digestion. Combined in column DNase I Digestion and RNA Cleanup. This procedure is based on the combined use of two different commercial kits (RNase-Free DNase Set and RNeasy Mini Kit). Please, use handling instructions of all buffers and reagents following their recommendations. Note: Buffers as RPE, RTL, RW1, RDD are supplied by the companies within the kits. Before starting RNA cleanup, make sure the DNase I and Buffer RPE are ready to use. Preparation of DNase I stock solution: Inject 550 μl RNase-free water into the lyophilized DNase I vial using an RNase-free needle and syringe. Mix gently by inverting the vial and divide it in 10 μl single-use aliquots. Store at -20 °C for up 9 months. Preparation of Buffer RPE: Add 4 volumes of 96-100% ethanol (44 ml) as indicated in the bottle. Adjust the RNA sample volume to 100 μl with RNase-free water. Add 350 μl of Buffer RLT and mix well by pipetting. Add 250 μl EtOH, mix well by pipetting. Transfer the sample to an RNeasy Mini spin column placed in a 2 ml collection tube. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 350 μl buffer RW1 to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 70 μl buffer RDD (supplied with the RNase-Free DNase Set) to 10 μl DNase I stock solution. Mix gently by inverting the tube. Note: Do not vortex. Add 80 μl of the DNase I incubation Mix to the RNeasy spin column, and place on the bench at RT for 15 min. Note: Add the Mix directly to the center of the RNeasy spin column membrane. Add 350 μl buffer RW1 to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 500 μl buffer RPE to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 500 μl buffer RPE to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 2 min. Note: The long centrifugation dries the spin column membrane, eliminating ethanol contamination. Quickly remove the RNeasy spin column from the collection tube so that the column does not contact the flow through. Place the RNeasy spin column in a new 2 ml collection tube. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at full speed for 1 min. Note: It is important to eliminate any possible buffer RPE carryover. Place the RNeasy spin column in a new 1.5 ml collection tube. Add 30 μl RNase-free water or DEPC-water to the center of the spin column membrane. Incubate 1 min at RT. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 1 min to elute the RNA. Add 20 μl RNase free water or DEPC-water to the center of spin column membrane to elute the maximum RNA. Incubate 1 min at RT. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 1 min. Use Nanodrop and/or Bioanalyzer to test the RNA quantity and quality. You should get 5-10 μg total RNA from 250-300 collected galls at 3 dpi of a high quality. Store the RNA sample in -80 °C for future use. Previously to sequencing, small RNAs were isolated by polyachrilamide gel electrophoresis and amplified by subsequently steps of RT-PCR and PCR with the help of 5’ and 3’ modified primers that specifically targeted microRNAs and other small RNAs that have a 3' hydroxyl group resulting from enzymatic cleavage by Dicer or other RNA processing enzymes. Illumina Solexa Sequencing-By-Synthesis technology was used to generate three small RNA libraries from 3dpi galls and three small RNA libraries from control root segments at Beijing Genomics Institute (Shenzhen, China).

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1838517: C1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Gall collection: To perform the RNA isolation from galls with a good efficiency, 250-300 hand dissected galls at 3 days post infection (3 dpi), should be collected. Collect galls and rapidly freeze them to a 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube in liquid nitrogen. Store at -80 °C until further processing (step C) Homogenization: Clean mortar and pestles with acetone, let them dry on the bench and autoclaved to avoid RNase activity. CAUTION: Check that mortar, pestle and pipettes used during the extraction have not been in contact with RNases. Sometimes it is preferable to keep material exclusively for RNA extraction. Add liquid nitrogen into the mortar with the pestle to cold them down. Add the galls into the mortar and proceed into a fume hood. When liquid nitrogen is nearly evaporated, add TRI Reagent® (500-750 μl/200-300 galls at 3 dpi); the total volume should not exceed 10% of the volume of TRI Reagent used for homogenization, as suggested by the TRI Reagent® protocol. Grind galls with a mortar and pestle. TRI Reagent solution initially becomes frozen, but it will melt gradually as a result of the homogenization. Proceed until a liquid appearance is observed and no visible tissue pieces are identified within the Reagent solution. Note: Do not leave traces of galls without homogenizing, since this step can be limiting for good efficiency. Transfer the gall homogenate with a pipette to a 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube and place it on ice while you homogenize the rest of the samples. Phase separation Centrifuge at 12,000 x g for 10 min at 4 °C and transfer the supernatant containing the RNA to a new 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube. Note: The resulting pellet contains membranes, polysaccharides and high molecular weight DNA while the supernatant contains RNA. All insoluble material should be removed from the homogenate. Note: Do not use vortex. Centrifuge the samples at 12,000 x g for 15 min at 4 °C. Transfer the upper aqueous phase to a new tube. Discard the supernatant. RNA Wash Wash the RNA pellet with 1 ml of 75% ethanol and mix by inversion several times. Centrifuge at 7,500 x g for 5 min at 4 °C and discard the supernatant. The white RNA pellet will turn clear when it dries out. Add 100 μl DEPC-water or RNase-free water immediately after the pellet becomes clear. Dissolve RNA by incubating for 10 min at 37 °C followed by 5 min at 60 °C. Store RNA solution at -80 °C or continue with further RNA Cleanup by DNase digestion. Add 80 μl of the DNase I incubation Mix to the RNeasy spin column, and place on the bench at RT for 15 min. Note: Add the Mix directly to the center of the RNeasy spin column membrane. Add 350 μl buffer RW1 to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 500 μl buffer RPE to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 500 μl buffer RPE to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 2 min. Note: The long centrifugation dries the spin column membrane, eliminating ethanol contamination. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at full speed for 1 min. Note: It is important to eliminate any possible buffer RPE carryover. Place the RNeasy spin column in a new 1.5 ml collection tube. Add 30 μl RNase-free water or DEPC-water to the center of the spin column membrane. Incubate 1 min at RT. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 1 min to elute the RNA. Use Nanodrop and/or Bioanalyzer to test the RNA quantity and quality. You should get 5-10 μg total RNA from 250-300 collected galls at 3 dpi of a high quality. Store the RNA sample in -80 °C for future use. Illumina Solexa Sequencing-By-Synthesis technology was used to generate three small RNA libraries from 3dpi galls and three small RNA libraries from control root segments at Beijing Genomics Institute (Shenzhen, China).

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM2928387: hyl1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Small RNAs were isolated using mirVana™miRNA Isolation Kit (Ambion, AM1561) Small RNA libraries were prepared and sequenced by Illumina high-throughput sequencing The small RNA reads were trimmed for adaptor sequence using Perl scripts and mapped to miRNA hairpin sequences downloaded from mirRBase version 15.0 using the Bowtie program

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: NextSeq 550 sequencing; GSM2995054: seedlings, rep1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: RNAs were isolated by the Total RNA was extracted using RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen, Germany) according to manufacturer. 2 μg total RNA was used to produce libraries using TruSeq Stranded Total RNA LT Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, USA). Pooled libraries were submitted to a NextSeq®550 sequencing platform (Illumina, USA) for sequencing.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: HiSeq X Ten sequencing; miRNA-Seq of Arabidopsis thaliana:leaf

DESIGN.DESIGN_DESCRIPTION: common methods

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM4203131: SUG6; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Buffer containing 0.1 M NaCl, 2% SDS, 50 mMTris–HCl (pH 9), 10 mMEDTA (pH 8) and 20 mM ß- mercaptoethanol was added to the frozen powder andRNA was extracted twice with phenol and recovered by ethanol precipitation. For small RNA analysis, total RNA was sep- arated on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and stained with ethidium bromide. Library construction has been realized by GATC Biotech All libraries were pooled together and sequenced on Illumina HiSeq 2000 platform

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM1979039: AtWTInf_2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: RNAs were isolated by the Total RNA was extracted using RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen, Germany) according to manufacturer. 2 μg total RNA was used to produce libraries using TruSeq Stranded Total RNA LT Sample Prep Kit (Illumina, USA). Pooled libraries were submitted to a NextSeq®550 sequencing platform (Illumina, USA) for sequencing.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM2151220: parp1parp2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: RNA was extracted with TRIzol reagent (Life Technologies, USA, 15596018) Small RNA fragments (~15–30 nucleotides) were selected and recovered from 10 µg of total RNAs by 15% urea-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Libraries were made using the NEBNext Small RNA Library Prep kit (NEB, USA) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Briefly, 3' and 5' adapters were ligated sequentially to the small RNAs. Ligated small RNAs were converted to cDNA by reverse transcription followed by PCR amplification for 15 cycles. The barcoded libraries were sequenced in one lane on the Illumina Hiseq2000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencing; GSM4472996: es3dd_smRNA_rep2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Gall collection: To perform the RNA isolation from galls with a good efficiency, 250-300 hand dissected galls at 3 days post infection (3 dpi), should be collected. Collect galls and rapidly freeze them to a 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube in liquid nitrogen. Store at -80 °C until further processing (step C) Homogenization: Clean mortar and pestles with acetone, let them dry on the bench and autoclaved to avoid RNase activity. CAUTION: Check that mortar, pestle and pipettes used during the extraction have not been in contact with RNases. Sometimes it is preferable to keep material exclusively for RNA extraction. Add liquid nitrogen into the mortar with the pestle to cold them down. Add the galls into the mortar and proceed into a fume hood. When liquid nitrogen is nearly evaporated, add TRI Reagent® (500-750 μl/200-300 galls at 3 dpi); the total volume should not exceed 10% of the volume of TRI Reagent used for homogenization, as suggested by the TRI Reagent® protocol. Grind galls with a mortar and pestle. TRI Reagent solution initially becomes frozen, but it will melt gradually as a result of the homogenization. Proceed until a liquid appearance is observed and no visible tissue pieces are identified within the Reagent solution. Note: Do not leave traces of galls without homogenizing, since this step can be limiting for good efficiency. Transfer the gall homogenate with a pipette to a 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube and place it on ice while you homogenize the rest of the samples. Phase separation Centrifuge at 12,000 x g for 10 min at 4 °C and transfer the supernatant containing the RNA to a new 1.5 ml Eppendorf® tube. Note: The resulting pellet contains membranes, polysaccharides and high molecular weight DNA while the supernatant contains RNA. All insoluble material should be removed from the homogenate. Add 100 μl of chloroform per 500 μl of TRl Reagent® in a fume hood. Cap sample tubes securely. Shake tubes vigorously by hand for 15 s and incubate them at room temperature (RT) for 5 to 10 min. Note: Do not use vortex. Centrifuge the samples at 12,000 x g for 15 min at 4 °C. Transfer the upper aqueous phase to a new tube. RNA precipitation Add 125 μl of isopropanol and 125 μl of high salt buffer per 500 μl of TRl Reagent®. Mix the solution and store it for 5-10 min at RT. Note: The high salt precipitation solution removes contaminating compounds as proteoglycan and polysaccharide from the isolated RNA. Centrifuge at 12,000 x g for 8 min at 4 °C. Discard the supernatant. RNA Wash Wash the RNA pellet with 1 ml of 75% ethanol and mix by inversion several times. Centrifuge at 7,500 x g for 5 min at 4 °C and discard the supernatant. Repeat steps E-1 and 2. Spin 10 sec in a microfuge and discard carefully the remaining liquid. Air dry the pellet for 3-5 min. Do not let the RNA over-dry, as this will make it difficult to dissolve. The white RNA pellet will turn clear when it dries out. Add 100 μl DEPC-water or RNase-free water immediately after the pellet becomes clear. Dissolve RNA by incubating for 10 min at 37 °C followed by 5 min at 60 °C. Store RNA solution at -80 °C or continue with further RNA Cleanup by DNase digestion. Combined in column DNase I Digestion and RNA Cleanup. This procedure is based on the combined use of two different commercial kits (RNase-Free DNase Set and RNeasy Mini Kit). Please, use handling instructions of all buffers and reagents following their recommendations. Note: Buffers as RPE, RTL, RW1, RDD are supplied by the companies within the kits. Before starting RNA cleanup, make sure the DNase I and Buffer RPE are ready to use. Preparation of DNase I stock solution: Inject 550 μl RNase-free water into the lyophilized DNase I vial using an RNase-free needle and syringe. Mix gently by inverting the vial and divide it in 10 μl single-use aliquots. Store at -20 °C for up 9 months. Preparation of Buffer RPE: Add 4 volumes of 96-100% ethanol (44 ml) as indicated in the bottle. Adjust the RNA sample volume to 100 μl with RNase-free water. Add 350 μl of Buffer RLT and mix well by pipetting. Add 250 μl EtOH, mix well by pipetting. Transfer the sample to an RNeasy Mini spin column placed in a 2 ml collection tube. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 350 μl buffer RW1 to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 70 μl buffer RDD (supplied with the RNase-Free DNase Set) to 10 μl DNase I stock solution. Mix gently by inverting the tube. Note: Do not vortex. Add 80 μl of the DNase I incubation Mix to the RNeasy spin column, and place on the bench at RT for 15 min. Note: Add the Mix directly to the center of the RNeasy spin column membrane. Add 350 μl buffer RW1 to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 500 μl buffer RPE to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 15 sec. Discard the flow-through. Add 500 μl buffer RPE to the RNeasy spin column. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 2 min. Note: The long centrifugation dries the spin column membrane, eliminating ethanol contamination. Quickly remove the RNeasy spin column from the collection tube so that the column does not contact the flow through. Place the RNeasy spin column in a new 2 ml collection tube. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at full speed for 1 min. Note: It is important to eliminate any possible buffer RPE carryover. Place the RNeasy spin column in a new 1.5 ml collection tube. Add 30 μl RNase-free water or DEPC-water to the center of the spin column membrane. Incubate 1 min at RT. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 1 min to elute the RNA. Add 20 μl RNase free water or DEPC-water to the center of spin column membrane to elute the maximum RNA. Incubate 1 min at RT. Close the lid gently and centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 1 min. Use Nanodrop and/or Bioanalyzer to test the RNA quantity and quality. You should get 5-10 μg total RNA from 250-300 collected galls at 3 dpi of a high quality. Store the RNA sample in -80 °C for future use. Previously to sequencing, small RNAs were isolated by polyachrilamide gel electrophoresis and amplified by subsequently steps of RT-PCR and PCR with the help of 5’ and 3’ modified primers that specifically targeted microRNAs and other small RNAs that have a 3' hydroxyl group resulting from enzymatic cleavage by Dicer or other RNA processing enzymes. Illumina Solexa Sequencing-By-Synthesis technology was used to generate three small RNA libraries from 3dpi galls and three small RNA libraries from control root segments at Beijing Genomics Institute (Shenzhen, China).

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencing; GSM4472992: es3_smRNA_rep2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: miRNeasy mini kit(Qiagen) NEBNext® Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using TRI-reagent (Molecular Research Center, Inc.) as per manufacturer's instructions. Contaminating DNA was removed by DNase I (Promega, Cat# M610A; Roche, Cat# 04716728001) digestion. cDNA was synthesized from 2 µg total RNAs using reverse transcriptase (Fermentas, Cat# EP0441) and an oligo-dT primer. Quantitative PCR was performed in triplicates on a Bio-Rad IQ cycler apparatus with the iQ SYBR green supermix (Bio-Rad, Cat# 170-8882).Values were obtained by normalizing to UBIQUITIN5. Small RNA libraries were prepared using the Illumina Tru-Seq kit and sequenced with Illumina's HiSeq2000 platform at the UCR Institute for Integrative Genome Biology (IIGB) genomic core facility.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencing; GSM4472993: es3_smRNA_rep3; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: AGO1-IP RNA extraction: 0.5g seedlings of Col and fry1-6 were ground in liquid nitrogen, the prowder was suspend with 1.5ml IP buffer containing 50mM Tris-Cl, pH7.5, 150mM NaCl, 0.1% NP40, 4mM MgCl2, 5mM DTT and 1x proteinase inhibitor cocktail (Roche). The slurry was clarified by 12000g centrifugation twice at 4℃. 4ul AGO1 antibody (Agrisera, AS09 527 ) was added into the supernatant and incubate for 2h at 4℃. Then 30ul Protein A Dynabeads (Invitrogen, 10002D) was added for 1h incubation at 4℃. IP products was washed by IP buffer for 4 times. RNAs were isolated from these samples by Tri Reagent (Molecular Research Center). 20ug total RNA was resolved on 15% Ura PAGE, and15-40nt small RNAs were recovered by gel purification. The recovery small RNA products were used for small RNA library construction with NEBNext® Multiplex Small RNA Library kit (NEB, E7300S).

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM3909549: fry1_AGO2_IP_1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

RNAs were isolated from these samples by Tri Reagent (Molecular Research Center). 20ug total RNA was resolved on 15% Ura PAGE, and15-40nt small RNAs were recovered by gel purification. The recovery small RNA products were used for small RNA library construction with NEBNext® Multiplex Small RNA Library kit (NEB, E7300S).

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using TRI-reagent (Molecular Research Center, Inc.) as per manufacturer's instructions. Contaminating DNA was removed by DNase I (Promega, Cat# M610A; Roche, Cat# 04716728001) digestion. cDNA was synthesized from 2 µg total RNAs using reverse transcriptase (Fermentas, Cat# EP0441) and an oligo-dT primer. Quantitative PCR was performed in triplicates on a Bio-Rad IQ cycler apparatus with the iQ SYBR green supermix (Bio-Rad, Cat# 170-8882).Values were obtained by normalizing to UBIQUITIN5. Small RNA libraries were prepared using the Illumina Tru-Seq kit and sequenced with Illumina's HiSeq2000 platform at the UCR Institute for Integrative Genome Biology (IIGB) genomic core facility.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: RNA was extracted with TRIzol reagent (Life Technologies, USA, 15596018) Small RNA fragments (~15–30 nucleotides) were selected and recovered from 10 µg of total RNAs by 15% urea-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Libraries were made using the NEBNext Small RNA Library Prep kit (NEB, USA) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Briefly, 3' and 5' adapters were ligated sequentially to the small RNAs. Ligated small RNAs were converted to cDNA by reverse transcription followed by PCR amplification for 15 cycles. The barcoded libraries were sequenced in one lane on the Illumina Hiseq2000.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: RNA was extracted with TRIzol reagent (Life Technologies, USA, 15596018) Small RNA fragments (~15–30 nucleotides) were selected and recovered from 10 µg of total RNAs by 15% urea-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Libraries were made using the NEBNext Small RNA Library Prep kit (NEB, USA) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Briefly, 3' and 5' adapters were ligated sequentially to the small RNAs. Ligated small RNAs were converted to cDNA by reverse transcription followed by PCR amplification for 15 cycles. The barcoded libraries were sequenced in one lane on the Illumina Hiseq2000.

Small RNA libraries were construct from 50ng of miRNA using Ion Total RNA-Seq Kit v2 (Ion Torrent, Life Technologies) according to manufacturer instruction. Libraries were then sequenced on Ion PI™ Template OT2 200 Kit v3 on ION PI v2 chip. Adapter were removed

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using TRI-reagent (Molecular Research Center, Inc.) as per manufacturer's instructions. Contaminating DNA was removed by DNase I (Promega, Cat# M610A; Roche, Cat# 04716728001) digestion. cDNA was synthesized from 2 µg total RNAs using reverse transcriptase (Fermentas, Cat# EP0441) and an oligo-dT primer. Quantitative PCR was performed in triplicates on a Bio-Rad IQ cycler apparatus with the iQ SYBR green supermix (Bio-Rad, Cat# 170-8882).Values were obtained by normalizing to UBIQUITIN5. Small RNA libraries were prepared using the Illumina Tru-Seq kit and sequenced with Illumina's HiSeq2000 platform at the UCR Institute for Integrative Genome Biology (IIGB) genomic core facility.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was isolated using the mirVana miRNA isolation kit (Ambion). Small RNAs (20 - 30 nt) were purified from 15% Novex TBE-Urea gel (Invitrogen) and ligated first with the 5' RNA adaptor and then with the 3' RNA adaptor provided by Illumina TruSeq small RNA sample preparation protocol. In each step, the ligated product was PAGE-gel purified. After first-strand synthesis and 11 cycles of PCR amplification, the product was PAGE-gel purified.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using TRI-reagent (Molecular Research Center, Inc.) as per manufacturer's instructions. Contaminating DNA was removed by DNase I (Promega, Cat# M610A; Roche, Cat# 04716728001) digestion. cDNA was synthesized from 2 µg total RNAs using reverse transcriptase (Fermentas, Cat# EP0441) and an oligo-dT primer. Quantitative PCR was performed in triplicates on a Bio-Rad IQ cycler apparatus with the iQ SYBR green supermix (Bio-Rad, Cat# 170-8882).Values were obtained by normalizing to UBIQUITIN5. Small RNA libraries were prepared using the Illumina Tru-Seq kit and sequenced with Illumina's HiSeq2000 platform at the UCR Institute for Integrative Genome Biology (IIGB) genomic core facility.

All the rest small RNA Libraries was constructed using the TruSeq Small RNA Library Kit from Illumina. Small RNA Libraries prepared using standard Illumina protocols.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM3602407: fry1-6_IP_2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: AGO1-IP RNA extraction: 0.5g seedlings of Col and fry1-6 were ground in liquid nitrogen, the prowder was suspend with 1.5ml IP buffer containing 50mM Tris-Cl, pH7.5, 150mM NaCl, 0.1% NP40, 4mM MgCl2, 5mM DTT and 1x proteinase inhibitor cocktail (Roche). The slurry was clarified by 12000g centrifugation twice at 4℃. 4ul AGO1 antibody (Agrisera, AS09 527 ) was added into the supernatant and incubate for 2h at 4℃. Then 30ul Protein A Dynabeads (Invitrogen, 10002D) was added for 1h incubation at 4℃. IP products was washed by IP buffer for 4 times. RNAs were isolated from these samples by Tri Reagent (Molecular Research Center). 20ug total RNA was resolved on 15% Ura PAGE, and15-40nt small RNAs were recovered by gel purification. The recovery small RNA products were used for small RNA library construction with NEBNext® Multiplex Small RNA Library kit (NEB, E7300S).

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM3602408: fry1-6_IP_3; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

The slurry was clarified by 12000g centrifugation twice at 4℃. 4ul AGO1 antibody (Agrisera, AS09 527 ) was added into the supernatant and incubate for 2h at 4℃. LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: RNA was extracted with TRIzol reagent (Life Technologies, USA, 15596018) Small RNA fragments (~15–30 nucleotides) were selected and recovered from 10 µg of total RNAs by 15% urea-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Libraries were made using the NEBNext Small RNA Library Prep kit (NEB, USA) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Briefly, 3' and 5' adapters were ligated sequentially to the small RNAs. Ligated small RNAs were converted to cDNA by reverse transcription followed by PCR amplification for 15 cycles. The barcoded libraries were sequenced in one lane on the Illumina Hiseq2000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM3602406: fry1-6_IP_1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: AGO1-IP RNA extraction: 0.5g seedlings of Col and fry1-6 were ground in liquid nitrogen, the prowder was suspend with 1.5ml IP buffer containing 50mM Tris-Cl, pH7.5, 150mM NaCl, 0.1% NP40, 4mM MgCl2, 5mM DTT and 1x proteinase inhibitor cocktail (Roche). The slurry was clarified by 12000g centrifugation twice at 4℃. 4ul AGO1 antibody (Agrisera, AS09 527 ) was added into the supernatant and incubate for 2h at 4℃. Then 30ul Protein A Dynabeads (Invitrogen, 10002D) was added for 1h incubation at 4℃. IP products was washed by IP buffer for 4 times. RNAs were isolated from these samples by Tri Reagent (Molecular Research Center). 20ug total RNA was resolved on 15% Ura PAGE, and15-40nt small RNAs were recovered by gel purification. The recovery small RNA products were used for small RNA library construction with NEBNext® Multiplex Small RNA Library kit (NEB, E7300S).

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 1000 sequencing; GSM1810033: Input RNA; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Extracts were prepared in 25 mM HEPES (pH 7.5), 100 mM NaCl, 5 mM EGTA, 2 mM MgCl, 0.05% v/v IGEPAL CA-630, 1 mM DTT, 10% Glycerin, 1x Complete Protease Inhibitor (Roche Applied Science, Mannheim) and 50 µM MG-132. Total RNA was extracted using Trizol Reagent. 3 mg of total protein were subjected to Ago-APP. After incubation for 3 h, the affinity-purfied sample was washed and APP-enriched RNA was extracted by addition of Trizol Reagent to the whole reaction. In short, an adenylated adapter was ligated to the 3’ end of the total RNA and APP-enriched RNA by a truncated T4 RNA Ligase 2, followed by the ligation of a 5’ RNA-adapter by T4 RNA Ligase 1 (NEB). After reverse-transcription using a specific primer, the cDNA was amplified by PCR, gel-fractionated and bands or regions corresponding to miRNA inserts were cut out. PCR products from these gel slices were eluted in elution buffer, precipitated and dissolved in water. The quality of the libraries was assessed by qPCR and Bioanalyzer measurements.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM2915075: chr2 rep2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using Trizol (Invitrogen) reagent from leaves of three week-old adult plants. sRNAs of 19-24 nt were gel-purified and ligated to a pair of adapters at the 5' and 3' ends by using T4 RNA ligase (NEB). sRNAs with adapters were transcribed into cDNA and amplified by Illumina sequencing-compatible primers.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM4203123: L1/dcl4; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Buffer containing 0.1 M NaCl, 2% SDS, 50 mMTris–HCl (pH 9), 10 mMEDTA (pH 8) and 20 mM ß- mercaptoethanol was added to the frozen powder andRNA was extracted twice with phenol and recovered by ethanol precipitation. For small RNA analysis, total RNA was sep- arated on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and stained with ethidium bromide. Library construction has been realized by GATC Biotech All libraries were pooled together and sequenced on Illumina HiSeq 2000 platform

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1402280: AGO10 OE 4mAGO1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using TRI-reagent (Molecular Research Center, Inc.) as per manufacturer's instructions. Contaminating DNA was removed by DNase I (Promega, Cat# M610A; Roche, Cat# 04716728001) digestion. cDNA was synthesized from 2 µg total RNAs using reverse transcriptase (Fermentas, Cat# EP0441) and an oligo-dT primer. Quantitative PCR was performed in triplicates on a Bio-Rad IQ cycler apparatus with the iQ SYBR green supermix (Bio-Rad, Cat# 170-8882).Values were obtained by normalizing to UBIQUITIN5. Small RNA libraries were prepared using the Illumina Tru-Seq kit and sequenced with Illumina's HiSeq2000 platform at the UCR Institute for Integrative Genome Biology (IIGB) genomic core facility.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM2327939: ago4-4 Rep1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA from immature Arabidopsis inflorescence and fully expanded maize leaves was extracted using the miRNeasy Mini kit (Qiagen) per the manufacturer's instructions. Small RNA libraries were prepared using the TruSeq Small RNA kit (Illumina) per the manufacturer's instructions.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM4203126: L1/ago1-27; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Buffer containing 0.1 M NaCl, 2% SDS, 50 mMTris–HCl (pH 9), 10 mMEDTA (pH 8) and 20 mM ß- mercaptoethanol was added to the frozen powder andRNA was extracted twice with phenol and recovered by ethanol precipitation. For small RNA analysis, total RNA was sep- arated on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and stained with ethidium bromide. Library construction has been realized by GATC Biotech All libraries were pooled together and sequenced on Illumina HiSeq 2000 platform

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM3738547: Leaf HMW 1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Crude extracts were purified from leaves and flowers using a buffer containing 50 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.5), 10 mM NaCl, 5 mM MgCl2 and 4 mM DTT. The extracts were size-fractionated on Sephacryl S-300 columns and fractions were collected. RNA content of the gel-filtration fractions was extracted with Trizolate Reagent (UD-GenoMed, Hungary) and fractions representing the identified sRNA pools were combined. The extracted RNA samples and also 30 μg of total RNA extracted directly from the crude extracts (input) were separated on an 8% denaturing polyacrylamide/urea gel along with RNA size markers, and then the sRNA range was isolated. The pellets were dissolved in 20 μl RNase-free ultrapure water, of which 2.5 μl was used for library preparation. The sRNA libraries were constructed using the Illumina TruSeq Small RNA Sample Prep Kit, according to the manufacturer's instructions.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM3738549: Leaf LMW 1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 1000 sequencing; GSM1810036: APP-enriched RNA; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Extracts were prepared in 25 mM HEPES (pH 7.5), 100 mM NaCl, 5 mM EGTA, 2 mM MgCl, 0.05% v/v IGEPAL CA-630, 1 mM DTT, 10% Glycerin, 1x Complete Protease Inhibitor (Roche Applied Science, Mannheim) and 50 µM MG-132. Total RNA was extracted using Trizol Reagent. 3 mg of total protein were subjected to Ago-APP. After incubation for 3 h, the affinity-purfied sample was washed and APP-enriched RNA was extracted by addition of Trizol Reagent to the whole reaction. In short, an adenylated adapter was ligated to the 3’ end of the total RNA and APP-enriched RNA by a truncated T4 RNA Ligase 2, followed by the ligation of a 5’ RNA-adapter by T4 RNA Ligase 1 (NEB). After reverse-transcription using a specific primer, the cDNA was amplified by PCR, gel-fractionated and bands or regions corresponding to miRNA inserts were cut out. PCR products from these gel slices were eluted in elution buffer, precipitated and dissolved in water. The quality of the libraries was assessed by qPCR and Bioanalyzer measurements.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 3000 paired end sequencing; GSM4044257: soe2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Arabidopsis seedlings were collected, frozen in liquid nitrogen, and RNA was harvested using Trizol reagent. Total RNAs from 14-day-old seedlings were resolved on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 40-400 nt were recovered from the gel. The size-fractionated RNAs were ligated to a 3' adaptor using T4 RNA ligase 2, truncated (NEB). The 3' adaptor-ligated RNAs were resolved on a 15% denature polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 60-420 nt were recovered. The size-fractionated RNAs were reverse-transcribed with an RT primer that is complementary to the 3' adaptor using SuperScript III (Life Technologies), followed by two-step PCR amplification. The cDNA was first amplified with the RT primer and a mixture of pre-miRNA-specific forward primers for 10 cycles and secondly amplified for 16 cycles with the 2nd PCR forward and reverse primers using Phusion DNA polymerase (NEB). The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1489503: heso1-2 Rep2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Flower inflorescences were collected and total RNA was extracted by Trizol. Illumina TruSeq Small RNA Sample Prep Kits was used with 1 ug of total RNA for the construction of sequencing libraries. Illumina small RNA library protocol

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1489494: Ler WT Rep1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM3738548: Leaf HMW 2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Crude extracts were purified from leaves and flowers using a buffer containing 50 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.5), 10 mM NaCl, 5 mM MgCl2 and 4 mM DTT. The extracts were size-fractionated on Sephacryl S-300 columns and fractions were collected. RNA content of the gel-filtration fractions was extracted with Trizolate Reagent (UD-GenoMed, Hungary) and fractions representing the identified sRNA pools were combined. The extracted RNA samples and also 30 μg of total RNA extracted directly from the crude extracts (input) were separated on an 8% denaturing polyacrylamide/urea gel along with RNA size markers, and then the sRNA range was isolated. The pellets were dissolved in 20 μl RNase-free ultrapure water, of which 2.5 μl was used for library preparation. The sRNA libraries were constructed using the Illumina TruSeq Small RNA Sample Prep Kit, according to the manufacturer's instructions.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM4471221: urt1-1 replicate1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 3000 paired end sequencing; GSM4044256: soe1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Arabidopsis seedlings were collected, frozen in liquid nitrogen, and RNA was harvested using Trizol reagent. Total RNAs from 14-day-old seedlings were resolved on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 40-400 nt were recovered from the gel. The size-fractionated RNAs were ligated to a 3' adaptor using T4 RNA ligase 2, truncated (NEB). The 3' adaptor-ligated RNAs were resolved on a 15% denature polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 60-420 nt were recovered. The size-fractionated RNAs were reverse-transcribed with an RT primer that is complementary to the 3' adaptor using SuperScript III (Life Technologies), followed by two-step PCR amplification. The cDNA was first amplified with the RT primer and a mixture of pre-miRNA-specific forward primers for 10 cycles and secondly amplified for 16 cycles with the 2nd PCR forward and reverse primers using Phusion DNA polymerase (NEB). The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM2731521: pRbcS:miRGFP Root; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted from 10 day-old Arabidopsis seedlings using TRIzol reagent (Invitrogen). Small RNA libraries were prepared from 1 µg of total RNA. The 'No miRGFP' small RNA Libraries was constructed using the NEBNext Multiplex Small RNA Library Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs). All the rest small RNA Libraries was constructed using the TruSeq Small RNA Library Kit from Illumina. Small RNA Libraries prepared using standard Illumina protocols.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Flower inflorescences were collected and total RNA was extracted by Trizol. Illumina TruSeq Small RNA Sample Prep Kits was used with 1 ug of total RNA for the construction of sequencing libraries. Illumina small RNA library protocol

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM2858363: Col x Col_seed coat; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Seeds from crosses between multiple individuals were hand-dissected and total embryo,endosperm, or seed coat RNA isolated using the Ambion RNAqueous Micro Kit. The small RNA pool was separated from the larger RNA pool by sequential ethanol addition and filtering. The larger RNA pool was collected on filters after the addition of ethanol equivalent to 60% of the sample volume, and the small RNA pool was collected on filters after the addition of ethanol equivalent to 50% of the flowthrough volume from the larger RNA filter binding step. Libraries for Illumina sequencing were constructed using the NEXTflex Small RNA-Seq Kit v2 as directed (Bioo Scientific Corporation, Austin, Texas). 40 base single-end sequencing of sRNA libraries was performed on an Illumina HiSeq 2000 machine.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM2858364: Col x Ler_seed coat; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM4203136: 6b4/SUG6/ago1-1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Buffer containing 0.1 M NaCl, 2% SDS, 50 mMTris–HCl (pH 9), 10 mMEDTA (pH 8) and 20 mM ß- mercaptoethanol was added to the frozen powder andRNA was extracted twice with phenol and recovered by ethanol precipitation. For small RNA analysis, total RNA was sep- arated on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and stained with ethidium bromide. Library construction has been realized by GATC Biotech All libraries were pooled together and sequenced on Illumina HiSeq 2000 platform

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 3000 paired end sequencing; GSM4044255: mac-7; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Arabidopsis seedlings were collected, frozen in liquid nitrogen, and RNA was harvested using Trizol reagent. Total RNAs from 14-day-old seedlings were resolved on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 40-400 nt were recovered from the gel. The size-fractionated RNAs were ligated to a 3' adaptor using T4 RNA ligase 2, truncated (NEB). The 3' adaptor-ligated RNAs were resolved on a 15% denature polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 60-420 nt were recovered. The size-fractionated RNAs were reverse-transcribed with an RT primer that is complementary to the 3' adaptor using SuperScript III (Life Technologies), followed by two-step PCR amplification. The cDNA was first amplified with the RT primer and a mixture of pre-miRNA-specific forward primers for 10 cycles and secondly amplified for 16 cycles with the 2nd PCR forward and reverse primers using Phusion DNA polymerase (NEB). The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 3000 paired end sequencing; GSM4044294: Ler rep1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

The size-fractionated RNAs were reverse-transcribed with an RT primer that is complementary to the 3' adaptor using SuperScript III (Life Technologies), followed by two-step PCR amplification. The cDNA was first amplified with the RT primer and a mixture of pre-miRNA-specific forward primers for 10 cycles and secondly amplified for 16 cycles with the 2nd PCR forward and reverse primers using Phusion DNA polymerase (NEB). The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1377381: dcl234 nrpd1 smRNAseq rep2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM2204307: untreated Col-0 rep 1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using the Direct-zol RNA MiniPrep Kit (ZymoResearch) and concentrated with RNA Clean and ConcentratorTM-5 (ZymoResearch). For AGO1 immunoprecipitation, around 2.5 mg of plant material was ground in liquid nitrogen, resuspended in extraction buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5; 150 mM NaCl; 10 % glycerol; 0.05 % Nonidet P-40; Proteinase-Inhibitor Roche cOmplete (EDTA-free); 1 mM PMSF), incubated at 4 °C for 20-30 min. on a rotator and centrifuged at 4 °C at 3200 g for 30 min. The protein extract was filtered (2x Miracloth and 1x syringe driven filter unit) and pre‑cleared with 100 ml protein A agarose beads for 30 min. on a rotator. After removal of the beads, supernatant was split in two fractions and incubated with/without 5 µl of AGO1 antibody (Agrisera; AS09 527) at 4°C for 2h on a rotator and an additional hour with 50 µl protein A agarose beads. Beads were collected by centrifugation and washed several times with extraction buffer. AGO1 complex was eluted with AGO1 peptide (Agrisera; AS09 527P) as described in Qi and Mi (2010) with minor modifications. AGO1 complex was eluted in 100 µl peptide elution solution (50 µg/ml). RNA and protein from the complex was extracted by adding TRIzol® reagent and incubation at 50 °C for 5 min. With chloroform, aqueous and organic phase were separated. The RNA containing, aqueous phase was further cleaned with chloroform and precipitated over night with one vol. isopropanol at ‑20 °C followed by centrifugation and washed with 80% ethanol. The organic phase was precipitated with 3 vol. acetone at -20 °C followed by centrifugation and washed with 80 % acetone. The extracted RNA was concentrated with RNA Clean and ConcentratorTM-5 (ZymoResearch). For total RNA libraries, small RNAs were isolated from 8 µg total RNA as described in Gilbert et al. (2014) and sRNA libraries were done with NEXTflexTM Small RNA Sequencing Kit (Bioo Scientific). sRNA libraries from the AGO1‑immunoprecipitated sRNAs were done according to the TruSeq® Small RNA Library Prep Kit (Illumina). All three biological replicates of each treatment of the total RNA sRNA libraries and the AGO1-immunoprecipitated sRNA libraries, respectively, were pooled and sequenced each on two different lanes.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 3000 paired end sequencing; GSM4044248: se-1 rep2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Arabidopsis seedlings were collected, frozen in liquid nitrogen, and RNA was harvested using Trizol reagent. Total RNAs from 14-day-old seedlings were resolved on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 40-400 nt were recovered from the gel. The size-fractionated RNAs were ligated to a 3' adaptor using T4 RNA ligase 2, truncated (NEB). The 3' adaptor-ligated RNAs were resolved on a 15% denature polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 60-420 nt were recovered. The size-fractionated RNAs were reverse-transcribed with an RT primer that is complementary to the 3' adaptor using SuperScript III (Life Technologies), followed by two-step PCR amplification. The cDNA was first amplified with the RT primer and a mixture of pre-miRNA-specific forward primers for 10 cycles and secondly amplified for 16 cycles with the 2nd PCR forward and reverse primers using Phusion DNA polymerase (NEB). The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

The size-fractionated RNAs were ligated to a 3' adaptor using T4 RNA ligase 2, truncated (NEB). The 3' adaptor-ligated RNAs were resolved on a 15% denature polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 60-420 nt were recovered. The size-fractionated RNAs were reverse-transcribed with an RT primer that is complementary to the 3' adaptor using SuperScript III (Life Technologies), followed by two-step PCR amplification. The cDNA was first amplified with the RT primer and a mixture of pre-miRNA-specific forward primers for 10 cycles and secondly amplified for 16 cycles with the 2nd PCR forward and reverse primers using Phusion DNA polymerase (NEB). The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 3000 paired end sequencing; GSM4044247: se-1 rep1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Flower inflorescences were collected and total RNA was extracted by Trizol. Illumina TruSeq Small RNA Sample Prep Kits was used with 1 ug of total RNA for the construction of sequencing libraries. Illumina small RNA library protocol

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1402282: sdn1 sdn2 AGO10 OE (I_s); Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using TRI-reagent (Molecular Research Center, Inc.) as per manufacturer's instructions. Contaminating DNA was removed by DNase I (Promega, Cat# M610A; Roche, Cat# 04716728001) digestion. cDNA was synthesized from 2 µg total RNAs using reverse transcriptase (Fermentas, Cat# EP0441) and an oligo-dT primer. Quantitative PCR was performed in triplicates on a Bio-Rad IQ cycler apparatus with the iQ SYBR green supermix (Bio-Rad, Cat# 170-8882).Values were obtained by normalizing to UBIQUITIN5. Small RNA libraries were prepared using the Illumina Tru-Seq kit and sequenced with Illumina's HiSeq2000 platform at the UCR Institute for Integrative Genome Biology (IIGB) genomic core facility.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM2204309: untreated Col-0 rep 3; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using the Direct-zol RNA MiniPrep Kit (ZymoResearch) and concentrated with RNA Clean and ConcentratorTM-5 (ZymoResearch). For AGO1 immunoprecipitation, around 2.5 mg of plant material was ground in liquid nitrogen, resuspended in extraction buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5; 150 mM NaCl; 10 % glycerol; 0.05 % Nonidet P-40; Proteinase-Inhibitor Roche cOmplete (EDTA-free); 1 mM PMSF), incubated at 4 °C for 20-30 min. on a rotator and centrifuged at 4 °C at 3200 g for 30 min. The protein extract was filtered (2x Miracloth and 1x syringe driven filter unit) and pre‑cleared with 100 ml protein A agarose beads for 30 min. on a rotator. After removal of the beads, supernatant was split in two fractions and incubated with/without 5 µl of AGO1 antibody (Agrisera; AS09 527) at 4°C for 2h on a rotator and an additional hour with 50 µl protein A agarose beads. Beads were collected by centrifugation and washed several times with extraction buffer. AGO1 complex was eluted with AGO1 peptide (Agrisera; AS09 527P) as described in Qi and Mi (2010) with minor modifications. AGO1 complex was eluted in 100 µl peptide elution solution (50 µg/ml). RNA and protein from the complex was extracted by adding TRIzol® reagent and incubation at 50 °C for 5 min. With chloroform, aqueous and organic phase were separated. The RNA containing, aqueous phase was further cleaned with chloroform and precipitated over night with one vol. isopropanol at ‑20 °C followed by centrifugation and washed with 80% ethanol. The organic phase was precipitated with 3 vol. acetone at -20 °C followed by centrifugation and washed with 80 % acetone. The extracted RNA was concentrated with RNA Clean and ConcentratorTM-5 (ZymoResearch). For total RNA libraries, small RNAs were isolated from 8 µg total RNA as described in Gilbert et al. (2014) and sRNA libraries were done with NEXTflexTM Small RNA Sequencing Kit (Bioo Scientific). sRNA libraries from the AGO1‑immunoprecipitated sRNAs were done according to the TruSeq® Small RNA Library Prep Kit (Illumina). All three biological replicates of each treatment of the total RNA sRNA libraries and the AGO1-immunoprecipitated sRNA libraries, respectively, were pooled and sequenced each on two different lanes.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1402284: sdn1 sdn2 AGO10 OE (II_f); Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired end sequencing; GSM5253720: WT-Mock 1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Samples were collected in tubes submerged in liquid nitrogen, so that the tissues were instantly flash frozen. RNA was extracted by Trizol (Life Technologies), followed by a chloroform phase separation according to the manufacturer's protocol. We then performed a second extraction using a 5:1 mix of acid phenol:chlorform, pH 4.5, and precipitated with 2 volumes of isopropanol. GMUCT 2.0 libraries were made by a home assembled and modified version of Illumina's TruSeq small RNA sequencing kit protocol, as outlined in Willmann, Berkowitz, and Gregory (2014) Improved genome-wide mapping of uncapped and cleaved transcripts in eukaryotes—GMUCT 2.0. Methods 67:64-73.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM3841995: Globular sRNA-seq (biorep 1); Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

For Samples 67-69, mRNA-seq libaries were generated according to the Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al. 2013. Nature Methods). sRNA-seq for Samples 1-33; nanoPARE for Samples 34-66; mRNA-Seq for Samples 67-69

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using the Direct-zol RNA MiniPrep Kit (ZymoResearch) and concentrated with RNA Clean and ConcentratorTM-5 (ZymoResearch). For AGO1 immunoprecipitation, around 2.5 mg of plant material was ground in liquid nitrogen, resuspended in extraction buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5; 150 mM NaCl; 10 % glycerol; 0.05 % Nonidet P-40; Proteinase-Inhibitor Roche cOmplete (EDTA-free); 1 mM PMSF), incubated at 4 °C for 20-30 min. on a rotator and centrifuged at 4 °C at 3200 g for 30 min. The protein extract was filtered (2x Miracloth and 1x syringe driven filter unit) and pre‑cleared with 100 ml protein A agarose beads for 30 min. on a rotator. After removal of the beads, supernatant was split in two fractions and incubated with/without 5 µl of AGO1 antibody (Agrisera; AS09 527) at 4°C for 2h on a rotator and an additional hour with 50 µl protein A agarose beads. Beads were collected by centrifugation and washed several times with extraction buffer. AGO1 complex was eluted with AGO1 peptide (Agrisera; AS09 527P) as described in Qi and Mi (2010) with minor modifications. AGO1 complex was eluted in 100 µl peptide elution solution (50 µg/ml). RNA and protein from the complex was extracted by adding TRIzol® reagent and incubation at 50 °C for 5 min. With chloroform, aqueous and organic phase were separated. The RNA containing, aqueous phase was further cleaned with chloroform and precipitated over night with one vol. isopropanol at ‑20 °C followed by centrifugation and washed with 80% ethanol. The organic phase was precipitated with 3 vol. acetone at -20 °C followed by centrifugation and washed with 80 % acetone. The extracted RNA was concentrated with RNA Clean and ConcentratorTM-5 (ZymoResearch). For total RNA libraries, small RNAs were isolated from 8 µg total RNA as described in Gilbert et al. (2014) and sRNA libraries were done with NEXTflexTM Small RNA Sequencing Kit (Bioo Scientific). sRNA libraries from the AGO1‑immunoprecipitated sRNAs were done according to the TruSeq® Small RNA Library Prep Kit (Illumina). All three biological replicates of each treatment of the total RNA sRNA libraries and the AGO1-immunoprecipitated sRNA libraries, respectively, were pooled and sequenced each on two different lanes.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: BGISEQ-500 sequencing; GSM4061711: Col-0 Rep 2 [small RNA-seq]; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: RNA's of 4 Arabidopsis lines (col-0, tt19 and two TT19 suppressors, all in triplicate) which were under AIC (3% sucrose shaking four days under 24h light) for four days was extracted using QIAGEN RNeasy Plant Mini Kit. Small RNA libraries were prepared by BGI company and sequenced using BGISEQ-500 as 50SE.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 3000 paired end sequencing; GSM4044288: ntp6-1ntp7-1 rep2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Arabidopsis seedlings were collected, frozen in liquid nitrogen, and RNA was harvested using Trizol reagent. Total RNAs from 14-day-old seedlings were resolved on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 40-400 nt were recovered from the gel. The size-fractionated RNAs were ligated to a 3' adaptor using T4 RNA ligase 2, truncated (NEB). The 3' adaptor-ligated RNAs were resolved on a 15% denature polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 60-420 nt were recovered. The size-fractionated RNAs were reverse-transcribed with an RT primer that is complementary to the 3' adaptor using SuperScript III (Life Technologies), followed by two-step PCR amplification. The cDNA was first amplified with the RT primer and a mixture of pre-miRNA-specific forward primers for 10 cycles and secondly amplified for 16 cycles with the 2nd PCR forward and reverse primers using Phusion DNA polymerase (NEB). The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1489498: hen1-2/heso1-2 Rep 1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Flower inflorescences were collected and total RNA was extracted by Trizol. Illumina TruSeq Small RNA Sample Prep Kits was used with 1 ug of total RNA for the construction of sequencing libraries. Illumina small RNA library protocol

RNA was extracted by Trizol (Life Technologies), followed by a chloroform phase separation according to the manufacturer's protocol. We then performed a second extraction using a 5:1 mix of acid phenol:chlorform, pH 4.5, and precipitated with 2 volumes of isopropanol. GMUCT 2.0 libraries were made by a home assembled and modified version of Illumina's TruSeq small RNA sequencing kit protocol, as outlined in Willmann, Berkowitz, and Gregory (2014) Improved genome-wide mapping of uncapped and cleaved transcripts in eukaryotes—GMUCT 2.0. Methods 67:64-73.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 3000 paired end sequencing; GSM4044292: heso1-1+pHESO1-HESO1 rep2; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Arabidopsis seedlings were collected, frozen in liquid nitrogen, and RNA was harvested using Trizol reagent. Total RNAs from 14-day-old seedlings were resolved on a 15% denaturing polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 40-400 nt were recovered from the gel. The size-fractionated RNAs were ligated to a 3' adaptor using T4 RNA ligase 2, truncated (NEB). The 3' adaptor-ligated RNAs were resolved on a 15% denature polyacrylamide gel and RNAs of 60-420 nt were recovered. The size-fractionated RNAs were reverse-transcribed with an RT primer that is complementary to the 3' adaptor using SuperScript III (Life Technologies), followed by two-step PCR amplification. The cDNA was first amplified with the RT primer and a mixture of pre-miRNA-specific forward primers for 10 cycles and secondly amplified for 16 cycles with the 2nd PCR forward and reverse primers using Phusion DNA polymerase (NEB). The PCR products were resolved on a 12% native polyacrylamide gel, and DNAs of 150-230 bp were recovered from the gel as the pre-miRNA 3' RACE-seq library. The library was sequenced on Illumina HiSeq3000.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM2204313: Alternaria brassicicola treated Col-0 rep 1; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Total RNA was extracted using the Direct-zol RNA MiniPrep Kit (ZymoResearch) and concentrated with RNA Clean and ConcentratorTM-5 (ZymoResearch). For AGO1 immunoprecipitation, around 2.5 mg of plant material was ground in liquid nitrogen, resuspended in extraction buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5; 150 mM NaCl; 10 % glycerol; 0.05 % Nonidet P-40; Proteinase-Inhibitor Roche cOmplete (EDTA-free); 1 mM PMSF), incubated at 4 °C for 20-30 min. on a rotator and centrifuged at 4 °C at 3200 g for 30 min. The protein extract was filtered (2x Miracloth and 1x syringe driven filter unit) and pre‑cleared with 100 ml protein A agarose beads for 30 min. on a rotator. After removal of the beads, supernatant was split in two fractions and incubated with/without 5 µl of AGO1 antibody (Agrisera; AS09 527) at 4°C for 2h on a rotator and an additional hour with 50 µl protein A agarose beads. Beads were collected by centrifugation and washed several times with extraction buffer. AGO1 complex was eluted with AGO1 peptide (Agrisera; AS09 527P) as described in Qi and Mi (2010) with minor modifications. AGO1 complex was eluted in 100 µl peptide elution solution (50 µg/ml). RNA and protein from the complex was extracted by adding TRIzol® reagent and incubation at 50 °C for 5 min. With chloroform, aqueous and organic phase were separated. The RNA containing, aqueous phase was further cleaned with chloroform and precipitated over night with one vol. isopropanol at ‑20 °C followed by centrifugation and washed with 80% ethanol. The organic phase was precipitated with 3 vol. acetone at -20 °C followed by centrifugation and washed with 80 % acetone. The extracted RNA was concentrated with RNA Clean and ConcentratorTM-5 (ZymoResearch). For total RNA libraries, small RNAs were isolated from 8 µg total RNA as described in Gilbert et al. (2014) and sRNA libraries were done with NEXTflexTM Small RNA Sequencing Kit (Bioo Scientific). sRNA libraries from the AGO1‑immunoprecipitated sRNAs were done according to the TruSeq® Small RNA Library Prep Kit (Illumina). All three biological replicates of each treatment of the total RNA sRNA libraries and the AGO1-immunoprecipitated sRNA libraries, respectively, were pooled and sequenced each on two different lanes.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: BGISEQ-500 sequencing; GSM4061703: tt19-8 S2 Rep 3 [small RNA-seq]; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: RNA's of 4 Arabidopsis lines (col-0, tt19 and two TT19 suppressors, all in triplicate) which were under AIC (3% sucrose shaking four days under 24h light) for four days was extracted using QIAGEN RNeasy Plant Mini Kit. Small RNA libraries were prepared by BGI company and sequenced using BGISEQ-500 as 50SE.

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Samples were collected in tubes submerged in liquid nitrogen, so that the tissues were instantly flash frozen. RNA was extracted by Trizol (Life Technologies), followed by a chloroform phase separation according to the manufacturer's protocol. We then performed a second extraction using a 5:1 mix of acid phenol:chlorform, pH 4.5, and precipitated with 2 volumes of isopropanol. GMUCT 2.0 libraries were made by a home assembled and modified version of Illumina's TruSeq small RNA sequencing kit protocol, as outlined in Willmann, Berkowitz, and Gregory (2014) Improved genome-wide mapping of uncapped and cleaved transcripts in eukaryotes—GMUCT 2.0. Methods 67:64-73.

For Samples 34-66, nanoPARE libraries were generated as described in the associated article. For Samples 67-69, mRNA-seq libaries were generated according to the Smart-seq2 protocol (Picelli et al. 2013. Nature Methods). sRNA-seq for Samples 1-33; nanoPARE for Samples 34-66; mRNA-Seq for Samples 67-69

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1863365: FRI;FLC fully-expanded leaf 9, day 33; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Samples were collected in tubes submerged in liquid nitrogen, so that the tissues were instantly flash frozen. RNA was extracted by Trizol (Life Technologies), followed by a chloroform phase separation according to the manufacturer's protocol. We then performed a second extraction using a 5:1 mix of acid phenol:chlorform, pH 4.5, and precipitated with 2 volumes of isopropanol. GMUCT 2.0 libraries were made by a home assembled and modified version of Illumina's TruSeq small RNA sequencing kit protocol, as outlined in Willmann, Berkowitz, and Gregory (2014) Improved genome-wide mapping of uncapped and cleaved transcripts in eukaryotes—GMUCT 2.0. Methods 67:64-73.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2000 sequencing; GSM1863366: FRI;FLC fully-expanded leaf 11, day 33; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Samples were collected in tubes submerged in liquid nitrogen, so that the tissues were instantly flash frozen. Methods 67:64-73.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: HiSeq X Ten sequencing; RNA seq of Arabidopsis thaliana: grafted shoots

DESIGN.DESIGN_DESCRIPTION: Total RNA quantity and integrity was measured with Qubit 2.0 and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) respectively. Small RNA library was prepared using Next Ultra small RNA Sample Library Prep Kit for Illumina (NEB). The sequencing procedure was performed with illumina HiSeq Xten system at BioMarker Technologies, Beijing, China. The total sRNA reads including miRNA and unannotated RNAs were then obtained by removing sequences from other non-coding RNAs, such as rRNA, tRNA, snRNA, snoRNA, repetitive sequence using Bowtie tool to align against the Silva, GtRNAdb, Rfam and Repbase databases.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM1664665: pollen of wt Col with the transgene KRP6pro::miR173site-trGFP; Arabidopsis thaliana; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Mature pollen was harvested by manual collection of open flowers into a 18% sucrose collection buffer placed on ice. Tubes containing the extraction buffer and open flowers vortexed were for 5 minutes and centrifugued for 3 minutes at 3,000 rpm in a centrifuge equiped with a tilt rotor. Pollen RNA was extracted with TRIzol reagent according to manufacterer instructions. Small RNA was enriched by cutting the 17-29nt small RNA fraction from a polyacrylamide gel and subsequent elution and precipitation. Cloning of small RNAs was performed using the Illumina TruSeq RNA Sample Preparation Kit

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencing; Ribo-seq of Arabidopsis thaliana: control conditions

DESIGN.DESIGN_DESCRIPTION: 400 mg grinded frozen leaf material was thawed on ice in 5 ml extraction buffer (200 mM Tris/HCl, pH 8.0, 200 mM KCl, 35 mM MgCl2, 200 mM sucrose, 1% Triton X-100, 2% polyoxyethylen-10-tridecyl-ether, 5 mM dithiothreitol, 100 µg/ml chloramphenicol, 50 µg/ml cycloheximide). The extract was centrifuged for 5 min at 13200 g, 4 °C to remove non soluble materials and nuclei, the supernatant was again centrifuged for 10 minutes at 15000 g, 4 °C. After addition of 5 mM CaCl2 and 750 units of Micrococcal nuclease (Thermo Fisher) the extract was incubated for 1 hour at room temperature and then loaded on a 2 ml sucrose cushion (40 mM Tris-acetate, pH 8.0, 100 mM KCl, 15 mM MgCl2, 1 M sucrose, 5 mM dithiothreitol, 100 µg/ml chloramphenicol, 50 µg/ml cycloheximide). After 3 h centrifugation at 55000 g at 4 °C using a Type 70.1 Ti rotor (Beckman) the pellet containing the ribosomes was solubilised in 1% SDS, 10 mM Tris, pH 8.0, and 1 mM EDTA. Small RNA containing footprints were isolated from the ribosome fraction using the PureLink miRNA Isolation Kit (Invitrogen). From the small RNA sample the 16-42 nt fraction was isolated by electrophoresis. This RNA fraction was treated with T4 polynucleotide kinase to dephosphorylate the 3’ ends before adaptor ligation.

DESIGN.DESIGN_DESCRIPTION: 400 mg grinded frozen leaf material was thawed on ice in 5 ml extraction buffer (200 mM Tris/HCl, pH 8.0, 200 mM KCl, 35 mM MgCl2, 200 mM sucrose, 1% Triton X-100, 2% polyoxyethylen-10-tridecyl-ether, 5 mM dithiothreitol, 100 g/ml chloramphenicol, 50 g/ml cycloheximide). After addition of 5 mM CaCl2 and 750 units of Micrococcal nuclease (Thermo Fisher) the extract was incubated for 1 hour at room temperature and then loaded on a 2 ml sucrose cushion (40 mM Tris-acetate, pH 8.0, 100 mM KCl, 15 mM MgCl2, 1 M sucrose, 5 mM dithiothreitol, 100 g/ml chloramphenicol, 50 g/ml cycloheximide). After 3 h centrifugation at 55000 g at 4 C using a Type 70.1 Ti rotor (Beckman) the pellet containing the ribosomes was solubilised in 1% SDS, 10 mM Tris, pH 8.0, and 1 mM EDTA. Small RNA containing footprints were isolated from the ribosome fraction using the PureLink miRNA Isolation Kit (Invitrogen). From the small RNA sample the 16-42 nt fraction was isolated by electrophoresis. This RNA fraction was treated with T4 polynucleotide kinase to dephosphorylate the 3 ends before adaptor ligation.

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; GSM2254670: Interface between haustorial tissue and attached host stem, replicate 1; Arabidopsis thaliana; Cuscuta pentagona; miRNA-Seq

LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR.LIBRARY_CONSTRUCTION_PROTOCOL: Small RNA was extracted from ~ 100 mg of host stem, interface, and parasite stem tissue using the mirPremier microRNA Isolation Kit (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Plant tissues were ground to a fine power in liquid nitrogen using mortar and pestle. Small RNA was analyzed using an Agilent small RNA Kit on a 2100 Bioanalyzer platform. Illumia Tru-Seq Indexed small RNA kit

EXPERIMENT.TITLE: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; miRNA-Seq of Arabidopsis thaliana: infloresence leaf biological replicate 1.For UMI-sRNA-seq, a 10-bp unique molecular identifier (UMI)-labeled primer was used for first strand synthesis.

DESIGN.DESIGN_DESCRIPTION: Total RNA was extracted from mixed stages of infloresence and used for small RNA library construction. Two biological replicate libraries were made for each genotype and sequenced.For UMI-sRNA-seq, a 10-bp unique molecular identifier (UMI)-labeled primer was used for first strand synthesis.
